snippet.title: What's on in Springfield this weekend
snippet.content: What's on in Springfield and surrounds this weekend: - Springfield Central SHS - FAME: The Musical Springfield Central SHS Presents FAME: The Musical. The world renowned musical will be performed by Sprinfield Central SHS students and is open to all. The musical will run from August 3-5 at the Springfield Central State High School Performing Arts Centre. For more information, contact Heather Coupland on 3470 6222 or email: hcoup6@eq.edu.au - Springfield Markets It's that time of the month where once again all of the Greater Springfield community come together to enjoy a range of activities, food stalls and entertainment for all the family. Held at the Robelle Domain Parklands, the event kicks off on Friday, August 4 from 4-9pm. For more information visit the Springfield Markets Facebook - McDonald's Augustine Heights Family Fun Day The newly opened restaurant in Augustine Heights will celebrate its opening with a Family F Day this Saturday from 10-2pm. The free event will feature a live radio broadcast from River 94.9 from 11am to 2pm and all kids will receive a free Happy Meal between 12 and 2pm with any large extra value meal purchase. There is also the chance for one lucky person to win coffee for a year. To find out more about the event, visit the McDonald's Augustine Heights Facebook - Event Cinemas Springfield Catch all the latest movies at Orion Springfield Central this weekend, with plenty on offer for all the family. Top picks this weekend feature The Big Sick, Cars III, War for the Planet of the Apes, Despicable Me 3 and Dunkirk. For all movie times, visit the Event Cinemas Springfield . - Oxley's Dogs on Patrol This Sunday, August 6, is time for you and your dog to head on down to Nixon Park on Oxley Road, Oxley for the Oxley, Mount Ommaney (Oxley Ridge) and Sherwood Neighbourhood Watch Dogs on Patrol event. Dogs on Patrol is a day run by Neighbourhood Watch and local police beats to educate the public, especially dog walkers, about how to keep a lookout for suspicious behaviour, people and vehicles in our neighbourhoods and how to report that information to police. Over 16 doggy related displays along with local police and Neighbourhood Watch members will be present. A coffee van, cupcakes and a sausage sizzle will also be on site. The event will also feature the official opening of the new council basketball court and gym with basketball and gym clinics. Live music will also be on at the event so bring a blanket, sit on the grass and enjoy the day. Neighbourhood Watch dog tags will also be available for a gold coin donation with Volunteers in Police able to engrave your dogs name and your phone number on the tags to make it easy to return your pooch if they ever get lost. When: 11am to 2pm Sunday, August 6 Where: Nixon Park, Oxley Road, Oxley For more information visit the Centenary Police .
